title: PES RR CSE or Drop for good IITs/NITs?

comments.body: Drop. Don't think. If you're prepared for a drop year. Take that leap of faith.
It's better to take a drop year

Aren't you writing JEE this year? What was your percentile in the first attempt?

How sure are you that you can consistently study for a year, every day? If you are general category, you need to be in top 6000 or so to get into the good NITs/IIITs

I got between 90-95 %ile this year. Well you can say I'm sure that if I gave some time to my current prep level it'll definitely land me above 98%ile or more. But the pressure of drop year and what's everyone is telling about it is scaring the shit out of me so I'm not sure and asked here. And yes I am general :(

I would rate PES above everything but the top 10 NITs and the top 5 IIITs, BITS and RVCE for CSE. I think you would need 99.3%ile to get those NIT/IIITs ( \~220 in JEE Mains). Figure out if you're ready to put the effort and commitment to achieve this.

I would consider a drop year only if fees would be a problem to pay for PES.
